data: Establishes a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word senses (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets, collected from financial news and press releases concerning Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset designed to understand sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and semantic Web technologies to better recognize, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Integrates entity-sentiment annotation to address the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset, consisting of over 10,700 news headlines, provides information on sentiment variations based on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset of speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts from the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), tokenized and annotated. This resource aims to understand the influence of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relationships within financial documents, comprising approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, organization-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, it allows researchers to explore how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, helping to identify and classify financial companies within textual data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP (Natural Language Processing) dataset, containing real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high and low-level topics, it facilitates multiclass and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with in-depth analysis of financial reports. Authored by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial queries.
